verb.description: Make (something) physically stronger or more solid.
examples: the first phase of the project is to consolidate the outside walls

verb.description: Combine (a number of things) into a single more effective or coherent whole.
examples: all manufacturing activities have been consolidated in new premises

origin: Early 16th century (in the sense combine into a whole): from Latin consolidare, from con- together + solidare make firm (from solidus solid).
